content:
Five Problems URIs Don't Solve
Larry Masinter, Xerox Palo Alto Research Center

Abstract:

Considering the history and goals of the various kinds of Uniform Resource Identifiers, there are a number of issues that were deemed "Someone Else's Problem". This talk reviews and gives examples of five problems that current and proposed URIs do not address, even though many believe that URIs should solve them.

TWIST 99

Irvine Research Unit in Software
Information and Computer Science
University of California, Irvine
Irvine, CA 92697-3425
